sentences.english: Among these, eastern sand-wind region is the most important sowing zon…
sentences.chinese: 其中東部風沙區是飛播的重點區。

sentences.english: The dune area in the northwest of Shanxi Province, is an area developing into desert.
sentences.chinese: 晉西北丘陵緩坡風沙區是沙漠化正在發展區。

sentences.english: Subtropical high has effect with other climate.
sentences.chinese: 副高和乾旱高溫，風沙氣候也有很好關係。

sentences.english: Supposing I have seventy-two changes, I'd like to change into a sturdy old pine to protect from wind and sand.
sentences.chinese: 假如我有七十二變，我要變成一棵蒼松去阻止風沙。

sentences.english: Grain to Green Program is an important measure in the treatment of sand and wind source from Tianjin and Beijing areas.
sentences.chinese: 退耕還林是京津風沙源治理工程中的一項重要措施。

sentences.english: It's very windy and dusty here in winter.
The Great Green Wall stops the sand from moving to the rich land in the south.
sentences.chinese: 綠色長城阻止了風沙吹向北方肥美的田地。

sentences.english: The area used to be struck by raging sandstorms.
sentences.chinese: 這個地區過去風沙猖獗。

sentences.english: One spring it was very windy and dusty here.
sentences.chinese: 有一年春天這裏風沙很大。

sentences.english: The shelterbelt kept the sand in check.
Hassan and Nassau lead the caravan and sand fight.
sentences.chinese: 哈桑老人和兒子納蘇，帶領商隊與風沙搏鬥。

sentences.english: The hazards of sandstorm and soil erosion are serious.
sentences.chinese: 風沙危害和水土流失嚴重。

sentences.english: Walls and drains have been built to keep out sand and water.
sentences.chinese: 修築了土牆和排水溝來防止風沙和水澇。

sentences.english: The windy and dusty weather coarsened her skin.
sentences.chinese: 風沙的氣候使她的皮膚粗糙了。

sentences.english: But lines of trees around cropland can catch blowing sand .
sentences.chinese: 但是農田周圍的防風林可以阻擋風沙。

sentences.english: Dry and cold in winter, when weather and sandstorms.
sentences.chinese: 冬季乾冷，時有風沙天氣。

definition: fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
Yumen Pass, or Jade Gate, western frontier post on the Silk Road in the Han Dynasty, west of Dunhuang, in Gansu
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
to carry within it/to be mixed in/to slip sth in/to intersperse/(hydrology etc) to entrain/to smuggle/notes smuggled into an exam
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
